class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.Accessibility
class.comment: This library includes several accessibility related methods. The SetNextFocus methods allow you to explicitly set the focus order. This order is important when the user navigates your application with a directional controller (such as D-Pad). SetContentDescription sets the content that will be used by accessibility services such as TalkBack to describe the interface.

method.name: SetNextFocusLeft
method.comment: Sets the next view that will get the focus when the user presses on the left key (and ThisView is focused).

method.name: SetNextFocusUp
method.comment: Sets the next view that will get the focus when the user presses on the up key (and ThisView is focused).

method.name: SetNextFocusRight
method.comment: Sets the next view that will get the focus when the user presses on the right key (and ThisView is focused).

method.name: SetContentDescription
method.comment: Sets the view's description. This text will be used by accessibility services to describe the view.

method.name: GetUserFontScale
method.comment: Returns the user set font scale. The user can adjust this scale in the device Settings. This scale is applied automatically to all text based views.

method.name: SetNextFocusDown
method.comment: Sets the next view that will get the focus when the user presses on the down key (and ThisView is focused). Example: Dim Access As Accessibility Access.SetNextFocusDown(Button1, Button2) 'When the focus is on Button1 and the user presses on the down key, 'the focus will move to Button2.
